activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio D. Johnson

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on December 15, 2022 at 10:45 am.
INITIAL SCHEDULING ORDER

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:54 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Antonio D. Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney Kelly J. Freeman appeared by video for Antonio D. Johnson. Officer Jacob Seuferer of the Janesville Police Department sworn testimony taken by video. Court takes judicial notice of bond in case 22CF184. State moves for bind over, defense objects without argument. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:52 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Antonio D. Johnson appeared by phone.  Attorney Kelly J. Freeman appeared by video for Antonio D. Johnson. Preliminary Hearing scheduled by zoom. Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

1:53 PM Defendant Antonio D. Johnson in court by video. Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court states attorney Freeman is prohibited from practicing law at this time. Defendant to contact public defenders office for reappointment of counsel. Bond to continue.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 27, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Activity:  Initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:40 PM Defendant Antonio D. Johnson in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Jason D Sanders by video.  David Zarwell and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address and date of birth verified. Court sets $1000 Signature Bond with conditions:  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of weapons. Must remain in residence from 6pm to 6am unless at work or traveling to and from work. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
Curfew from 6pm to 6am unless traveling to/from work. Absolute sobriety. Not to possess any weapons. Not to possess any controlled substance without a prescription.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
